newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan, US to hold financial services talks March 5.
newsitem.headline: Japan, US to hold financial services talks March 5.

text.p: Japanese and U.S. senior officials will hold a follow-up meeting of bilateral financial services talks on March 5 in Tokyo, Japan's Finance Ministry (MOF) said on Tuesday.
The meeting will be between the U.S. Treasury's Senior Deputy Assistant Secretary Timothy Geithner and Hideichiro Hamanaka, senior deputy director-general of MOF's International Finance Bureau.
A senior MOF official told reporters there were no pending issues between the two nations but added that Japan's "Big Bang" financial reforms would be one of the issues discussed.
